headline: Bernstein downgrades FedEx stock and lowers price target
summary: FedEx (FDX) shares are in focus after Bernstein analysts downgraded the stock to market perform from overperform and lowered their price target to $316 from $337. Julie Hyman and Josh Lipton review the details of the analyst note on Market Domination. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination here. This post was written by Naomi Buchanan.

headline: FedEx Stock Drops on Downgrade as Analyst Cites Increasing Risks
summary: FedEx  stock fell early Tuesday after a formerly upbeat Wall Street analyst cut his rating, citing a variety of challenges facing the logistics company.  Monday evening, Bernstein analyst David Vernon downgraded FedEx shares to Hold from Buy.  FedEx is integrating its separate express and ground delivery networks to become more efficient and lower costs—a significant challenge in terms of execution.

headline: 3 High-Yield Dividend Stocks You Can Buy and Hold for a Decade
summary: The stock market is near record highs, but there are still some opportunities to be found, especially for income investors.  There are some excellent dividend stocks that are trading for significant discounts to their recent highs, and they could have big tailwinds as the falling-rate environment continues.  While there are dozens of great dividend stocks you can buy right now, here are three that look like especially compelling opportunities.

headline: FedEx rating cut at Bernstein on execution risk
summary: Investing.com -- FedEx has been downgraded to "Market-Perform" by Bernstein analysts, citing a confluence of execution, event, and policy risks that could weigh on the stock. The price target was reduced to $316 from $337.
